div.p:
The Caledonia School Board meeting on April 20, 2020, at 6:00 pm will be held virtually.
A live-stream can be viewed at https://eduvision.tv/l?mDRtLO The live stream will also be linked to the district webpage at the Live Event option under Our District.
If you wish to speak during the Interested Citizens portion of the meeting agenda you will need to join the meeting via this link.

a.span: MI School Data Visit Our Dashboard

div.p: We value the implementation of a comprehensive curriculum to prepare our students for college and career readiness.
We value a learning environment that promotes the physical, social and emotional well being for each student.
We value the opportunity to shape each student by modeling integrity, intentionally teaching character traits and encouraging a strong work ethic.
We value our community as a vital component of the educational process. Our success is defined by the strength of our community.

The district is closely following the direction of local, state and national agencies regarding the Coronavirus (COVID-19). For the latest information and updates from Caledonia Community Schools visit our Coronavirus Resource and Communication Page.

p.a: Caledonia Community Schools Continuity of Learning Plan (CLP)

The Caledonia Data Dashboard will allow you to find the information you need to understand our district, see how we operate, and learn why we're a great choice for you and your children.

div.h3: Dialogue with Doc Martin will be held in a Virtual Town Hall on Monday April 13, 2020 @ 6pm.
div.div: Join us live for a virtual town hall to learn more about Caledonia Community Schools’ two proposals appearing on the May 5, 2020, ballot. Superintendent Dr. Dedrick Martin and Director of Finance Sara DeVries will be taking your questions about the Operating Millage Renewal and School Bond Proposal and talking about what they both mean for the future of Caledonia Community Schools. Get your questions answered Monday night.
